author: cardanochina
title: Chinese Discord+Telegram groups
description: Com o crescimento da comunidade chinesa do Cardano Telegram, é cada vez mais desafiador responder a diferentes tópicos de perguntas

f6_assessments.q0:
Giving the opportunity to ADA community to grow on China is a huge thing. It is vital for any business, in order to scale up to its maximum, enter in Chinese community. That said, I do think that this proposal addresses the challenge.

One point, though, is that I am thinking that maybe creating a material or a translation of the existing material together with this proposal would benefit to its maximum. I am imagining that in China the English language is not well adopted, therefore I imagining how a normal citizen will start to develop its curiosity towards ADA (it would be hard to start studying and understand everything since the majority of its material is in English). Maybe, the groups are a step after the lecturing material.
f6_assessments.q1:
TELEGRAM:
I believe that this is totally feasible since you're already doing it. Although, there are some points that caught my attention: Since the proposal is based in a 3 months budget, I was wondering 1) what is going to happen when the budget runs out after the 3 months? Will the project stop? 2) Since China has a huge growing potential, based on its community size, I am wondering if one moderator, working 1,5 h/d will be able to organize and answering everything in an effective manner – it is not scalable; 3) Gather community feedback on Telegram is quite easy since you have the opportunity to use robots there, that said, maybe this money could be associated with other activity.

DISCORD:
Basically, I have the same points that I've made before.
f6_assessments.q2: As explained in this proposal, the growth tracking of these platforms is a good metric to know if there are more people interested. However, it would be great if there are some method to verify if these people are really joining the ADA community, submitting proposals and/or making it grow. Actually, maybe this could be added with a survey in both, Telegram and Discord.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer identified the problem of the need for a more organized telegram group for the Cardano Chinese-speaking community. As a solution it was proposed to start a discord server and hire a moderator for the telegram and discord group. As this proposal will improve access to information about Cardano for the Chinese community, it is in line with the multilingual challenge to motivate non-English speakers to learn and grow the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal does not present a plan to remain financially sustainable in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer presented evidence of his experience. The budget has been detailed but appears to be overpriced. The proposal presents a realistic deadline for the work to be carried out. The proposal presents a detailed plan of what will be done. The proposal does not pose risks for its implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal clearly presented the target problem and its solution. Provided a roadmap with milestones which is important for monitoring the project's progress. It also presented KPIs that are important to measure the success of the work.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal definitely fits into the challenge because organizing and managing a Discord server (and Telegram) for Cardano Chinese-speaking community would not only allow Chinese speakers have a place to connect, exchange ideas and ask questions  about Cardano, but also increase Cardano's adoption  worldwide. I strongly agree the proposal is impactful because the proposal addresses most of the objectives in the challenge's success:
    - Increase adoption and community engagement of non-English speakers
    - A sense of community and conversations. Having people around to talk with.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer successfully built a YouTube channel where videos about Cardano in Chinese already published. She is managing a Chinese Cardano Telegram group with 1010 members (screenshot of the Telegram group proves that number). The proposer had 1 funded proposal (Fund4). They are evidences for the author's experience and relevant skills for the successful implementation. 
The budget is outlined very clearly and broken down into identifiable items and be reasonable to achieve the set goals. (There is a small mistake about this item in budget broken down list: 'Gather feedback about the moderator's work on Telegram' is available twice. I understand it is on Telegram and on Discord.)
The plan is very sensible and conductible, roadmap with milestones and timetable is clearly.
Therefore, I strongly agree the proposal is likely to be successfully implemented.
I recommend the proposer should add link of the existing Telegram group as it is mentioned in the proposal (even though the screenshot of that group is provided but I think link is better) and link of the funded proposal in Fund4.
Besides, the proposer should consider challenge and risk relevant to the successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
In my opinion, the proposal is auditable. Roadmap with milestone and time horizon and most of KPIs make it easy to be audited the progress and the success of proposal.
I would like to know how this KPI is audited: better community atmosphere?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer already manages a page for the Chinese that is already in 1000s. This is already impactful but if the proposer is seeking to hire someone to do it then expect the target to be quite higher. Also, I would have loved to see what happens when the fund is over especially with the hired hands. i thought that a team of community members will be put together so that even when the funds period is over, they can still hold while waiting for funds.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the experience of the proposer, previous works with other funds, and the plans put forth, the project can be implemented smoothly. Also, the budget is clarified and very understandable
f6_assessments.q2: the goals of the proposal are clearly stated with the timelines to accomplish them. Also, the project will provide means to audit performance.

f6_assessments.q0: This project is about starting discord and telegram groups in Chinese language. This project has to potential to bring hundreds of millions of new Cardanians. It meets the challenge criteria and can have a huge impact on Cardano's development. Considering that this proposal requests less than 1/10 of the total challenge funds, there should be no doubt that this proposal is valuable !
f6_assessments.q1:
In principle creating a telegram and discord channel is not difficult. The main challenge is well identified: hiring a skilled moderator, educating him about Cardano, and monitoring his activity. This is all very well identified in a 3 months roadmap.
The use of the funding (reasonnable budget) is very well detailed, which gives confidence in the project.
The proposer has already been funded in Fund 4 and delivered content about Cardano in Chinese language. Though I'm not able to check the quality of the translation, I consider based on this experience that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal defines success criteria based on telegram and discord members, though not very ambitions considering that Chinese is the most spoken language in the world. 
This Kpis will be public, so it will be easy for the community to monitor the progress of this project.

f6_assessments.q0: The goal is relevant, realistic. Chinese speakers is a large market to attract. Moveover, the need of having moderator for Telegram and Discord group is naturally grow up because she already work on these job and when the community become bigger (which proves that she handle her job properly).
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is really clear about what she will do. She has experience in similar activities and the plan is not hard to action. The proposal include clear roadmap and goal. Eventhough the proposal is concise, it very complete since it have all needed parts: demonstrate of problem, explaination of solution, roadmap and action plan, transparancy, KPIs.
f6_assessments.q2: It's easy to see that there is a new Discord server and moderator for telegram group. The performance metric is on point: very clear and have specific quantity number for each metric. The proposal also include Roadmap, which make it easy to track the project's progress.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a very good proposal, very meaningful. The Cardano Chinese-speaking community needs a more organized Telegram group and a place where people's questions are answered in a more topic-specific manner. They will be provided with basic knowledge about Cardano in their own mother tongue, thereby helping the ecosystem grow.
f6_assessments.q1:
While the proposer has shown sufficient evidence to demonstrate the skills and experience needed to implement the proposal, it would be interesting to know your profile (linked in,...)
Performance metrics/KPIs/budget allocations have been provided in detail, which makes evaluation a lot easier. However, to increase the persuasion, it is necessary to have a statistics of the number of users using Chinese, thereby giving an appropriate performance index/KPI (here, "number of members in the Telegram group: over 1200")
The roadmap and action plan consists of 3 months, I think it is advocating to make a long-term roadmap (6 months / 12 months / ...), identify tasks in each specific timeline, clarify how the project will work for a long time, that will give people more basis to measure success.
f6_assessments.q2:
I have looked at all the information the proposers provide, based on it, people can fully judge the success of this project.
However, to increase the persuasion, I think there should be a longer-term roadmap,... (as I mentioned in the previous section). Besides, it is necessary to add ways to attract people to Telegram and Discord groups (marketing, communication,...).
This is a potential project, it seems simple, but the effect is huge. I hope in the future, this project will be implemented successfully.

solution: Iniciar um servidor Discord. Contratar um moderador para o grupo Telegrama e Discord. Livestream semanal para responder perguntas ao vivo em chinês.
experience:
Entregue com sucesso a proposta do China Info Hub (do Fundo 4):
criação de conteúdo, construção de comunidade, marketing, comunicação intercultural
